column2: ENGLISH
[From.GetFullName], a witcher in your employment has expressed his desire to leave your court.
[From.GetFullName] will leave your court\n
[From.GetSheHeCap] can leave if [From.GetSheHe] wishes to.
[From.GetFullName] will stay longer\n
[From.GetSheHeCap] will surely not refuse a request of a friend.
Some coin will surely change [From.GetHerHis] mind.
Since these lands are peaceful [From.GetSheHe] could stay a bit longer and rest.
And I just wanted to honor [From.GetHerHis] service.
A lover surely would be a good reason to stay longer.
[From.GetFullName] is visiting your court offering [From.HetHerHis] skills as a witcher and seeking your employment.
Ok.
I have no need for witcher.
Throw him in prison.

Honoured [Root.GetTitledName],

I wish to inform you that [From.GetName] is plagued by monsters no more.

Witcher [FromFrom.GetFullName]

Honoured [Root.GetTitledName],

I wish to inform you that [From.GetName] is plagued by monsters no more. Although the monsters were more than I expected and I got injured.

Witcher [FromFrom.GetFullName]

[FromFrom.GetFullName] went to [From.GetName] to clean it from monsters infesting it. There haven't been any news from [FromFrom.GetHerHim] and the monsters are still runing rampant. Sadly it can only mean that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] died.
I'll need a new witcher.
Your soldiers and peasants are falling prey to monsters every day, while you have a witcher rotting in jail. Maybe it would be a good idea to pardon the witcher for killing some monsters.
Why should others die when I have witcher to do it.
I have no need for a witcher, nor will I pardon anyone!
[From.GetName] has been cleaned the monsters, although the witcher took the chance and escaped, leaving your lands far behind.
Oh, well.
There have been some dissatisfaction and even outright complaining in your court about you employing a witcher.
The witcher will stay!
Maybe they are right, I don't need witcher.
[This.GetFullName] will leave your court\n
